member.summary: Creates valid opaque value.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.RequestMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets request method.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Realm
member.summary: Gets or sets a string to be displayed to users so they know which username and password to use. This string should contain at least the name of the host performing the authentication and might additionally indicate the collection of users who might have access. An example might be "registered_users@gotham.news.com".

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Nonce
member.summary: Gets or sets a server-specified unique data string. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data. Suggested value: base64(time-stamp hex(time-stamp ":" ETag ":" private-key)).
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Opaque
member.summary: Gets or sets string of data, specified by the server, which should be returned by the client unchanged. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data.
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets algorithm to use to produce the digest and a checksum. This is normally MD5 or MD5-sess.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Response
member.summary: Gets a string of 32 hex digits computed by HTTP digest algorithm, which proves that the user knows a password.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets user name.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets password.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Uri
member.summary: Gets the URI from Request-URI.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.Qop
member.summary: Gets or sets value what indicates "quality of protection" the client has applied to the message. If present, its value MUST be one of the alternatives the server indicated it supports in the WWW-Authenticate header. This directive is optional in order to preserve backward compatibility.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.CNonce
member.summary: Gets or sets Client nonce value. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field.

member.name: P:PX.Common.Authentication.HttpDigest.NonceCount
member.summary: Gets or stets nonce count. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field. The nc-value is the hexadecimal count of the number of requests.

member.name: T:PX.Common.Trie
member.summary: Double-array implementation of a trie (prefix tree).
member.remarks:
Look-up is O(1) on average and O(k) in the worst case, and insertion is about O(k^2) in the worst case, where k is the number of input symbols.
References: 1. Karoonboonyanan, T. An Implementation of Double-Array Trie 2. Aoe, J. An Efficient Digital Search Algorithm by Using a Double-Array Structure 3. Kanda, S., Morita K., Fuketa M., Aoe J. Experimental Observations of Construction Methods for Double Array Structures Using Linear Functions.

member.name: M:PX.Common.EnumerableExtensions.OrderBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},``1[])
member.summary: Ordering with priorities. The method extends the LINQ OrderBy method with an array of priorities (values of the same type as the selector output). is applied to each item of the collection, then the index in the array is found. The collection is sorted according to these indexes: the item with the lower index in the priority array goes first, the item not present in the priority array goes last. After that the LINQ ThenBy(keySelector) method is applied.
member.param: A variable-length parameters list containing keys in priority order.

member.name: T:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet
member.summary:
IMAP sequence-set. RFC 3501.
Examples: 2 -> seq-number (2) 2:4 -> seq-range (from 2 - 4) 2:* -> seq-range (from 2 to last) 2,3,10:* -> sequence-set (seq-number,seq-number,seq-range) (2,3, 10 - last)
NOTES: *) comma separates sequence parts *) * means maximum value.

member.name: M:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses sequence-set from specified string. Throws exception if invalid sequnce-set value.

member.name: M:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet.Parse(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Parses sequence-set from specified string. Throws exception if invalid sequnce-set value.
member.param: Maximum value. This if for replacement of * value.

member.name: M:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet.Contains(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets if sequence set contains specified number.

member.name: M:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet.ToSequenceSetString
member.summary: Converts IMAP_SequenceSet to IMAP sequence-set string.

member.name: M:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet.Parse_Seq_Number(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Parses seq-number from specified value. Throws exception if invalid seq-number value.
member.param: Maximum value. This if for replacement of * value.

member.name: P:PX.Common.IMAP.SequenceSet.Items
member.summary: Gets sequence set ranges.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.name: T:PX.Common.Mail.HeaderReceived
member.summary: Represents "Received:" header. Defined in RFC 5321 4.4.

remarks.code:
RFC 5321 4.4. Time-stamp-line = "Received:" FWS Stamp CRLF
Stamp = From-domain By-domain Opt-info [CFWS] ";" FWS date-time ; where "date-time" is as defined in RFC 5322 [4] ; but the "obs-" forms, especially two-digit ; years, are prohibited in SMTP and MUST NOT be used.
From-domain = "FROM" FWS Extended-Domain
By-domain = CFWS "BY" FWS Extended-Domain
Extended-Domain = Domain / ( Domain FWS "(" TCP-info ")" ) / ( address-literal FWS "(" TCP-info ")" )
TCP-info = address-literal / ( Domain FWS address-literal ) ; Information derived by server from TCP connection not client EHLO.
Opt-info = [Via] [With] [ID] [For] [Additional-Registered-Clauses]
Via = CFWS "VIA" FWS Link
With = CFWS "WITH" FWS Protocol
ID = CFWS "ID" FWS ( Atom / msg-id ) ; msg-id is defined in RFC 5322 [4]
For = CFWS "FOR" FWS ( Path / Mailbox )
Additional-Registered-Clauses = CFWS Atom FWS String
Link = "TCP" / Addtl-Link
Addtl-Link = Atom
Protocol = "ESMTP" / "SMTP" / Attdl-Protocol
Mailbox = Local-part "@" ( Domain / address-literal )

member.name: T:PX.Common.MIME.BodyMessageDeliveryStatus
member.summary: This class represents MIME message/delivery-status body. Defined in RFC 3464.

remarks.code:
delivery-status-content = per-message-fields 1*( CRLF per-recipient-fields )
per-message-fields = [ original-envelope-id-field CRLF ] reporting-mta-field CRLF [ dsn-gateway-field CRLF ] [ received-from-mta-field CRLF ] [ arrival-date-field CRLF ] *( extension-field CRLF )
per-recipient-fields = [ original-recipient-field CRLF ] final-recipient-field CRLF action-field CRLF status-field CRLF [ remote-mta-field CRLF ] [ diagnostic-code-field CRLF ] [ last-attempt-date-field CRLF ] [ final-log-id-field CRLF ] [ will-retry-until-field CRLF ] *( extension-field CRLF )

member.name: F:PX.Common.MIME.DispositionTypes.Inline
member.summary: A bodypart should be marked `inline' if it is intended to be displayed automatically upon display of the message. Inline bodyparts should be presented in the order in which they occur, subject to the normal semantics of multipart messages.

member.name: F:PX.Common.MIME.DispositionTypes.Attachment
member.summary: Bodyparts can be designated `attachment' to indicate that they are separate from the main body of the mail message, and that their display should not be automatic, but contingent upon some further action of the user.

member.summary: Gets or sets URI for retrieving a body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: URI using which the content of this body-part part was retrieved, might be retrievable, or which otherwise gives a globally unique identification of the content.

member.name: P:PX.Common.MIME.Entity.Contentfeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets content features of a MIME body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: The 'Content-features:' header can be used to annotate a MIME body part with a media feature expression, to indicate features of the body part content. See also RFC 2533, RFC 2506, and RFC 2045.

member.name: P:PX.Common.MIME.Entity.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets content disposition. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Indicates whether a MIME body part is to be shown inline or is an attachment; can also indicate a suggested filename for use when saving an attachment to a file.
member.exception: Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: P:PX.Common.MIME.Entity.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets language of message content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Can include a code for the natural language used in a message; e.g., 'en' for English. Can also contain a list of languages for a message containing more than one language.

member.name: P:PX.Common.MIME.Entity.ContentAlternative
member.summary: Gets or sets message alternative content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Information about the media features of alternative content formats available for the current message.

member.name: P:PX.Common.MIME.Entity.ContentMD5
member.summary: Gets or sets content MD5 checksum. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Checksum of content to ensure that it has not been modified.

member.name: P:PX.Common.MIME.Entity.ContentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets time duration of content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.name: T:PX.Common.MIME.HeaderContentDisposition
member.summary: Represents "Content-Disposition:" header. Defined in RFC 2183.

example.code:
RFC 2183. In the extended BNF notation of [RFC 822], the Content-Disposition header field is defined as follows:
disposition := "Content-Disposition" ":" disposition-type *(";" disposition-parm)
disposition-type := "inline" / "attachment" / extension-token ; values are not case-sensitive
disposition-parm := filename-parm / creation-date-parm / modification-date-parm / read-date-parm / size-parm / parameter
filename-parm := "filename" "=" value
creation-date-parm := "creation-date" "=" quoted-date-time
modification-date-parm := "modification-date" "=" quoted-date-time
read-date-parm := "read-date" "=" quoted-date-time
size-parm := "size" "=" 1*DIGIT
quoted-date-time := quoted-string ; contents MUST be an RFC 822 `date-time' ; numeric timezones (+HHMM or -HHMM) MUST be used

member.name: M:PX.Common.MIME.HeaderContentDisposition.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: The disposition-type. Known values are in DispositionTypes.
member.exception: Is raised when dispositionType is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.name: M:PX.Common.MIME.HeaderContentDisposition.#ctor
member.summary: Internal parser constructor.

member.name: M:PX.Common.MIME.HeaderContentDisposition.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses header field from the specified value.
member.param: Header field value. Header field name must be included. For example: 'Content-Type: text/plain'.
member.exception: Is raised when value is null reference.
Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: M:PX.Common.MIME.HeaderContentDisposition.ToString(PX.Common.MIME.EncodingEncodedWord,System.Text.Encoding,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns header field as string.
member.param: 8-bit words ecnoder. Value null means that words are not encoded.
Charset to use to encode 8-bit characters. Value null means parameters not encoded.
If true always specified encoding is used. If false and header field value not modified, original encoding is kept.

member.name: T:PX.Common.MIME.HeaderContentType
member.summary: Represents "Content-Type:" header. Defined in RFC 2045 5.1.

remarks.code:
RFC 2045 5.1. In the Augmented BNF notation of RFC 822, a Content-Type header field value is defined as follows:
content := "Content-Type" ":" type "/" subtype *(";" parameter) ; Matching of media type and subtype ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
type := discrete-type / composite-type
discrete-type := "text" / "image" / "audio" / "video" / "application" / extension-token
composite-type := "message" / "multipart" / extension-token
extension-token := ietf-token / x-token
ietf-token := (An extension token defined by a standards-track RFC and registered with IANA.)
x-token := (The two characters "X-" or "x-" followed, with no intervening white space, by any token)
subtype := extension-token / iana-token
iana-token := (A publicly-defined extension token. Tokens of this form must be registered with IANA as specified in RFC 2048.)
parameter := attribute "=" value
attribute := token ; Matching of attributes ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
value := token / quoted-string
token := 1*(any (US-ASCII) CHAR except SPACE, CTLs,or tspecials)
tspecials := "(" / ")" / "<" / ">" / "@" / "," / ";" / ":" / "\" / " "/" / "[" / "]" / "?" / "=" ; Must be in quoted-string, ; to use within parameter values

member.name: T:PX.Common.MIME.TransferEncodings
member.summary: This class holds MIME content transfer encodings. Defined in RFC 2045 6.

member.name: F:PX.Common.MIME.TransferEncodings.SevenBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line of the code range 1..127 with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. This is the default value. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:PX.Common.MIME.TransferEncodings.EightBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:PX.Common.MIME.TransferEncodings.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Designed to be efficient and mostly human readable when used for text data consisting primarily of US-ASCII characters but also containing a small proportion of bytes with values outside that range. Defined in RFC 2045 6.7.

member.name: F:PX.Common.MIME.TransferEncodings.Base64
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Has a fixed overhead and is intended for non text data and text that is not ASCII heavy. Defined in RFC 2045 6.8.

member.name: F:PX.Common.MIME.TransferEncodings.Binary
member.summary: Any sequence of octets. This type is not widely used. Defined in RFC 3030.

member.name: T:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities
member.summary: This class holds known POP3 extended capabilities. Defined in http://www.iana.org/assignments/pop3-extension-mechanism.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.TOP
member.summary: The TOP capability indicates the optional TOP command is available. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.USER
member.summary: The USER capability indicates that the USER and PASS commands are supported. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.SASL
member.summary: The SASL capability indicates that the AUTH command is available and that it supports an optional base64 encoded second argument for an initial client response as described in the SASL specification. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.RESP_CODES
member.summary: The RESP-CODES capability indicates that any response text issued by this server which begins with an open square bracket ("[") is an extended response code. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.LOGIN_DELAY
member.summary: LOGIN-DELAY capability. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.PIPELINING
F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.EXPIRE
member.summary: EXPIRE capability. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.UIDL
member.summary: UIDL command is supported. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: F:PX.Common.POP3.Pop3ExtendedCapabilities.STLS
member.summary: STLS(start TLS) command supported. Defined in RFC 2449.

member.name: P:PX.Common.PXHostingEnvironment.IsHosted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current application domain is being hosted by an object, and the domain was not internally created from code for service purposes.

remarks.para: Some parts of the system (like CustomizationProjectBuilder) may create an application domain from the code by using method.
In that case, is true but the list of running applications is empty because the new application is created with flag.

member.summary: The offset of the byte currently addressed by Position, into the block that contains it

member.name: M:PX.Common.SparseMemoryStream.ToArray
member.summary: Returns the entire content of the stream as a byte array. This is not safe because the call to new byte[] may fail if the stream is large enough. Where possible use methods which operate on streams directly instead.

member.name: F:PX.Common.SMTP.DsnNotify.NotSpecified
member.summary: Notify value not specified.
member.remarks: For compatibility with SMTP clients that do not use the NOTIFY facility, the absence of a NOTIFY parameter in a RCPT command may be interpreted as either NOTIFY=FAILURE or NOTIFY=FAILURE,DELAY.

member.summary: DSN should not be returned to the sender under any conditions.

member.name: F:PX.Common.SMTP.DsnNotify.Success
member.summary: DSN should be sent on successful delivery.

member.summary: DSN should be sent on delivery failure.

member.param: Specifies if delimiter is removed from underlying string.
